discourse_list.title: Hackers Steal $625 Million From Axie Infinity's Ronin Sidechain

content.content: I came across this article and thought some may find it of interest. According to the article the theft occurred on March 23 when the attackers use hacked private keys to “forge fake withdrawals” through a backdoor route, draining 173,600 ether (ETH) and 25.5M of USDC. Hackers steal $615 million in crypto from Axie Infinity’s Ronin Network (yahoo.com) Stay vigilant out there friends.

Yes this hack is terrible, what seems strange to me is that he is not an experienced hacker, apparently he sent and received funds from Binance and FTX. So it is very likely that this person will be tracked down.

Well I don’t know anything about the hacker but from my observations there are many inexperienced bad actors thinking they can get away with things they won’t.  In the U.S. recently the Department of Justice has been very active with respect to crypto and NFTs. One pattern that I have seen is how quick and relatively easy it is to track much of this stuff on-chain (when using certain platforms). In the end, the bad actors hurt everyone and we all need to stay safe.

Actually, I think they intentionally did that to distract the investigation. We seen such similar tactics before. You can see that the amount and the process seems too precise to just expose oneself. But either way, an unfortunate news indeed  image1280×604 106 KB

Well, hopefully the people investigating know that and are on top of it. Always sad to hear this stuff but hopefully we can all learn from it. I’m a pessimist by nature so I must try and remain positive
